summary: This document is a chain of emails from July 2020 between attorneys and U.S. Attorney's Office personnel regarding scheduling a meeting and conveying investigative questions to a client about his potential recognition of and relationship with a U.S. Customs and Border Protection employee connected to Jeffrey Epstein. It reveals an ongoing investigation into Epstein's associates in the Virgin Islands.

persons.name: Glen G. McGorty
persons.role: Managing Partner at Crowell & Moring LLP
persons.context: Attorney communicating with the U.S. Attorney's Office to schedule a call and convey investigative questions to his client regarding recognition of an individual connected to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Danielle Giffuni
persons.context: Appears to be an attorney or staff member at the U.S. Attorney's Office, copied on email correspondence regarding the meeting and investigation.

persons.name: Daniel Zelenko
persons.context: Appears to be an attorney or staff member at the U.S. Attorney's Office, copied on email correspondence regarding the meeting and investigation.

persons.name: Donnie Murrell
persons.context: Attorney previously contacted in 2019 regarding scheduling a meeting, referenced in the 2020 email chain as the prior point of contact for the same client.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier and convicted sex offender; the investigation concerns an individual who may have had a friendship with him in the Virgin Islands.

connections.description: McGorty is the attorney representing the unnamed client, conveying investigative questions from the U.S. Attorney's Office to him.
The CBP employee may have had a friendship with Epstein, visited his home, and accompanied him on boat, helicopter, and/or plane trips.
The investigation seeks to determine if McGorty's client recognizes the CBP employee and if the employee introduced individuals to the client at a bar or other location.
Professional correspondence regarding scheduling a meeting and an ongoing investigation.
Murrell was the prior attorney of record for the same client, contacted in 2019 regarding a meeting.

events.title: Email Scheduling Follow-up Call
events.description: Email exchange finalizing a time for a call between attorneys and the U.S. Attorney's Office to discuss the client's recognition of a photo.

events.title: Provision of Investigative Details
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office provides Glen McGorty with additional information about a U.S. Customs and Border Protection employee to convey to his client, to see if it jogs the client's memory.

events.title: Reference to Office Turmoil
events.description: McGorty references 'crazy times' and 'recent developments' at the U.S. Attorney's Office, with alums expressing support and disappointment.

events.title: Prior Meeting Scheduling Attempt
events.description: Previous email exchange from August 2019 regarding tentatively scheduling a meeting with the client for the week of August 19th.

locations: Southern District of New York (U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office is investigating a U.S. Customs and Border Protection employee who worked in Saint Thomas and may have been friends with Jeffrey Epstein.
The CBP employee is alleged to have visited Epstein's home in the Virgin Islands and accompanied him on boat, helicopter, and/or plane trips.
Investigators are seeking to determine if the attorney's client recognizes the CBP employee and if that employee introduced individuals to the client at a Virgin Islands bar or other location.
The email chain shows coordination between a private defense attorney (Glen McGorty) and federal prosecutors to gather information from a client as part of an ongoing investigation.
The correspondence references prior contact with the client's previous attorney, Donnie Murrell, in August 2019, indicating a longer-term investigative interest.
